result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian T. Norton

defendant.name: Norton, Christian T.
defendant.address: 1353 South Blue Island, Apt C6, Chicago, IL 60608

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christian T. Norton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF41, 15CF65, 15CF191, 15CF243, 15CF244
10:52 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF243 Counts 1, 2 & 4 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Court notes the plea/questionaire indicates 15CF41. 
Atty McFarland does not object to the Court replacing that with the correct case number 15CF243.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF243 Counts 1, 2 & 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following: 
15CF243 Counts 3 & 5
15CF244
15CF191
15CF65
15CF41

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF243 Counts 1 & 2 -
Serve 150 days jail - STAYED - 
3 days credit.
24 months probation, concurrent to any probation he is currently on in Illinois:
Obtain AODA and comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain any prescription medications he needs and notify agent of that pharmacy and sign any necessary releases so the agent can monitor. 
Maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination of both.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. 
Pay costs.  To be paid during the period of probation. 

15CF243 Count 4 - 
Pay fine of $250 plus costs.  To be taken out of any bond posted on any of the files.  Any remainder to be applied to the costs in counts 1 & 2. Balance to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.

ADDRESS INFO for Christian T. Norton
Current: 1353 South Blue Island, Apt C6, Chicago, IL 60608 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2015)
Prior: 925 Franklin Street #3, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Arraignment at 08-24-2015 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-24-2015 11:30 am.
Comply with conditions of all bonds ordered.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Christian T. Norton in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files 15CF243, 15CF244
  Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:30 am.
